reviewText:
Roll'd Reviewby David =D

FUN, addicting, and plenty of content!
Roll'd is a game that anyone could love, regardless of their gaming background.

What really makes it fun, is local and multiplayer! What makes it addicting for me is the level system, and my desire to break personal records.

If you are still hesitant about picking up Roll'd, please.. watch me broadcast... or something! This game really is worth picking up.

reviewText: Roll'd" is a really surprisingly fun game. I bought it due to my prefererence for SAS (short attention span) games and multiple levels to be unlocked with a gradual progression. Figured if I played for an hour it would be reasonable at this remarkably low price. After three days I have most of the achievements and have passed level 40 (of 50 for which achievements are offered.)\n\nThe premise of Roll'd is that instead of the character moving
date: the path does. Perhaps a small change
recommended: but a very nice variation from the norm. At various points new levels and variations are unlocked
hoursPlayed: as well as new and bizarre "runners". The numerous paths may only be different in appearance

votesHelpful: it's a good one.\n\nThe art and music of Roll'd are really nice
votesTotal: and all in all this is a remarkable game for this low price of less than a dollar. If you like dexterity or running games

reviewText:
I paid €0.25 for Roll'd, thanks to the ever so useful Steam Coupons. For €0.25, you're getting a small time killer that you can play for 10-15 minutes at a time, trying to beat your old scores and set new ones, perhaps even go the extra mile to try obtain those pesky steam achievements, tied to scores for Easy, Normal & Hard.

Using A & D to shift the camera to keep you balanced, you're on the path of spirals and slopes, sharp ones too. You've gotta keep your concentration on the path ahead while trying to keep the camera balanced to not fall off from the path. As you die (many, many times), you'll earn XP to rank up and during the process, you'll earn some new skins and level backgrounds alongside additional difficulty modes.

What is the game worth?

I wouldn't recommend paying more than €0.50 for it. If you're able to obtain or craft by chance the 75% coupon, it would be easily worth the spare cents for some extra entertainment. Paying €0.50 would be the absolute maximum that could be recommended. Anything above €0.50 and you're going to set yourself up for dissatisfaction.

Overall, I'd give it 6/10 based on the content and slightly 'addictive' gameplay.

Score: Good ( 6 )

reviewText:
F'ing Roll'd.
This is one of those endless running, two button games that could be a phone game but works just as well as a time waster on this platform, too.

In Roll'd you control the ground you run on by rotating the track, its relatively simple at slow speeds but on higher difficulty settings it gets very hectic and infuriating, you will always want to beat your top score.

Pros:
+Good Soundtrack
+Lots of runners with pretty solid animations
+Around 50 levels with unlockables along the way
+Great scenery
+Good learning curve
+Cheap

Cons:
-Glitchy menus
-Repetitive Gameplay
-Hard to find multiplayer games

reviewText:
Basic Information
Title: Roll'd
Developer: MGP Studios
Publisher: Forever Entertainment S. A.
Genre: Infiniti Runner

General Impression
This game is fully worth their $1, cause you could kill time to easily by just playing a game. I really recommend this game to you if you like playing games like Subway Surfers or something like that. You can even play online with your buddies that maybe live across the other world, or you can play Local Online where you share your keyboard with your friend and BAM you two can play together. This game is just lovely!

Strong Points
• It's an easy and interactive game
• You can kill time with this game
• The controls are very simple
• Singleplayer, Local and Online is the game modes you can play
• The maps does not ever end
• It is a one of the best pixel games on steam

Weak Points
The games freezes when you open the game. Then it dissapeares when you quit and reopens

General Ratings
Graphics: 8/10
Atmosphere: 6/10
Audio/Music: 9/10
Gameplay: 7.4/10
Story: N/A
Engines/Mechanics: 7/10

Personal Rating: 7/10

Go get it <3

reviewText:
Super Addictive arcade game with minimal visuals
In this game you are person that needs to run more and more, but make sure you don't fall off by straightening levels!

Getting leveled up in this game fairly easy if you grind easy levels over and over

Pros
Easy to learn and hard to master!
Super fast and addictive gameplay
Great minimal visuals
Nice soundtrack!
Cheap price!

Cons
No separate points counting system for each level types (only shows best of all time and not in this current level)
Nobody is playing multiplayer...
You will forget time and play this over and over again...

Roll'd Review:

Genre: Infinite Runner
Wait... Did i just say INFINITE RUNNER.
Sorry, we have to many of those, guess i have to make this a NEGATIVE review...











Or not.
This game seems to take Infinite Runner's to a next level by not only showing they are good on the PC just as much they are on the mobile, but that they also show that on the PC this genre can have good controls and decent graphics.

And I love it.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Review copy provided from developer. Note that my ability to enjoy a game is not influenced by how I recieved it. If you would like to see the TL;DR, go to the summary at the bottom of the review.
Roll'd is a simplistic endless runner with the same sort of novelty provided from games such as Timberman.

The gameplay is, like most simplistic games, simple. You assist a variety of characters through a variety of different worlds by making their journey across different terrains horizontal (to some extent). You do this by pressing the arrow keys for keyboard and left stick for controller. Personally, I found keyboard to be the easiest way to control the game as it felt more precise. In regards to how fun this gameplay is, it's more the type of game you can jump into for 10-15 minutes to try and beat your old highscore. For a single dollar, it gives you a fair amount enjoyment.

Roll'd has decent enough graphics, and an interesting idea of switching up the art style of each area you unlock which manages to keep it mildly refreshing. I did notice that in the second area, the graphics do not seem anywhere near as crisp as they did in the other areas.

The music tends to get quite repetitive and somewhat annoying. The sounds (e.g. the annoying pig squeal played each time you die) were even more annoying and drove me to switch them off in the settings.

The only other issue I had was with the fact that the game isn't exactly fullscreen once you start playing.


Summary:
Pros:
✔ Fun game to pop in and play
✔ Cheap
✔ Decent graphics

Cons:
✘ Area 2's graphics aren't as high quality (minor issue)
✘ Music & sounds get annoying
✘ Not exactly fullscreen

Conclusion:
Roll'd is a bit of fun to entertain you every now and then. Would I recommend it? Sure. It's a small dose of fun that costs you hardly anything, just don't expect too much from it.

Rating: 6.6/10

Did you enjoy that review? Make sure to check out my curator page at Sour Fruits United and/or read my other reviews. If you had any things you liked/disliked make sure to tell me in the comments below.

reviewText: Overall a pretty good game. Aesthetically its a good looking game, especially with the landscapes, there's replayabilty for sure and is actually quite addicting. So far the only issues i've seen are with the characters you unlock, Though you unlock them after a certain level, they are actually all usable from the beginning. I will say however that the only reason I thought to purchase the game was with a 75% discount. For 25 cents I'd say it's worth it, good to relax and zone-out
